page.title: 05Falklands Memorial,Marchwood
page.content: The construction of the memorial started on the 19th March 1984.It is in memory of {the Falklands Conflict } during which the Marchwood based ship RFA Sir Galahad was sunk, and the RFA Sir Tristram was badly damaged.It was suggested that a permanent reminder of the link between the Royal Fleet Auxiliary and Marchwood would be fitting.So a memorial garden was laid out near the church and dedicated to those members of the RFA who were lost during the war.The service was attended by many of those who served in local ships during the campaign and some families of those who died.Part of the memorial is made from carved rock that was brought from the Falkland Islands.This was the first permanent memorial to be dedicated to the Royal Fleet Auxiliary in its entire 73 years of existence.
